titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Corinna Radigan papers 1960-1989 LSC.2193
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Stacy Wood, 2013; Sabrina Ponce, 2017; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cub√©.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

publicationstmt.date: Online finding aid last updated 03 January 2018.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2018-01-03T15:03-0800

did.abstract: Corinna Radigan was a sports writer for several newspapers and magazines, including the Bay Area Reporter. This collection compiles her and several women's work, brought together by Radigan, including unpublished stories and manuscripts as well as materials related to The Coming Out project and various correspondence between authors.
did.physloc: Stored off-site at SRLF. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: COLLECTION STORED OFF-SITE AT SRLF: Open for research. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Reproduction and Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical object belong to the UCLA Library Special Collections. Literary rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Corinna Radigan papers, (Collection 2193). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection is part of an outreach and collection-building partnership between the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives, the UCLA Center for the Study of Women (CSW), and the UCLA Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Stacy Wood, 2013. Description enhanced and further physical processing completed by Sabrina Ponce in 2017.

odd.head: Sponsor
odd.p: The June L. Mazer Lesbian Archive at UCLA is an outreach and collection-building partnership between the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives, the UCLA Center for the Study of Women (CSW), and the UCLA Library. These collections expand the pool of primary source materials available to researchers and to the community at large. This partnership was initiated by CSW and is funded by the National Endowment for the Humanities (NEH) to inventory, organize, preserve, and digitize more than eighty Mazer collections pertaining to lesbian and feminist activism and writings.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Corinna Radigan was a sports writer working with various newspapers and magazines including the Bay Area Reporter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains various unpublished manuscripts and writings from Kary Wind, Lee Lynch, Shirley Gore, Rochelle Dubois and Corinna Radigan as well as materials related to The Coming Out project and correspondence between authors such as Lyndall McCowan (who was also a member of the Daughters of Bilitis) and Barbara Grier.

list.item: Barbara Grier Periodical collection (Collection 2130). Available at Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA.
Daughters of Bilitis records (Collection 1946). Available at Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA.

controlaccess.corpname: June L. Mazer Lesbian Archive at UCLA.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence between Lyndall MacCowan and Barbara Grier (co-founder of the Naiad Press), concerning young lesbian organization and a study guide for the audio cassette "On Being Gay" recorded by United Presbyterian Church, 1973. MacCowan was an active member of the San Francisco chapter of the Daughters of Bilitis.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: A copy of The Phoenix and the Lotus Myour Letters of C.H. to the artist Rochelle.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Contains a carbon copy of the first typed draft of Toothpick House by Lee Lynch

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Correspondence to and from Nancy Ruthchild Manahan of the Epona Press about Caterpillars: Journal Entries by Eleven Women, one of their titles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Includes biographical sheet and the manuscript for Screaming Alone, about surviving incest.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Unpublished stories and other writings by Shirley Gore.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a coming out story by Claudia Johnson as well as two coming out letters to parents, one by an anonymous author and the other by Juana Maria Paz. These letters were part of a call for "coming-out correspondence" by the West Coast Lesbian Collections (the former name of the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Articles in a number of publications by Corinna Radigan.
